Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, probably a column-krater; interior: glazed with narrow reserved band; exterior glazed at top; below, black-figure lion's head, with added red neck and top of shoulder, to left, looking back; mouth open with long tongue.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 473, no. B815)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0115) (Phase 1)
